page.title: 06Old Memories of Wimborne.
page.content: I spoke to an old lady who has lived in Wimborne all her life. She told me that when she was a little girl there were only gas street lights in Wimborne and a man came around to light them. On Tuesdays it was market day and cattle used to go past her on her way to school. There was one blacksmith in Wimborne and he was in King Street. On Saturday evenings the shops used to stay open until 9 p.m. and Wimborne was very busy. Outside the Albion a lady called Cockle Kate sold sea food which she sold from a barrow. The Salvation Army always played in the Square on Saturday evenings. Petrol was l/4d. a gallon and electricity was ld. in the meter.In the war there were four bombs dropped in Colehill. RACHEL WOODS.aged 8 years.
